task.name: ant

attribute.name: antfile
attribute.description: The buildfile to use. Defaults to "build.xml". This file is expected to be a filename relative to the dir attribute given.

attribute.name: dir
attribute.description: The directory to use as a base directory for the new Ant project. Defaults to the current project's basedir, unless inheritall has been set to false, in which case it doesn't have a default value. This will override the basedir setting of the called project.

attribute.description: If true, pass all properties to the new Ant project. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: inheritrefs
attribute.description: If true, pass all references to the new Ant project. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: output
attribute.description: Filename to write the output to. This is relative to the value of the dir attribute if it has been set or to the base directory of the current project otherwise.

attribute.name: target
attribute.description: The target of the new Ant project to execute. Defaults to the new project's default target.

element.name: reference
element.description: Reference element identifying a data type to carry over to the new project.

element.name: property
element.description: Property to pass to the new project. The property is passed as a 'user property'

task.name: basename
task.description:
Sets a property to the base name of a specified file, optionally minus a suffix. This task can accept the following attributes:
  • file
  • property
  • suffix
The file and property attributes are required. The suffix attribute can be specified either with or without the ".", and the result will be the same (ie., the returned file name will be minus the .suffix).

When this task executes, it will set the specified property to the value of the last element in the specified file. If file is a directory, the basename will be the last directory element. If file is a full-path filename, the basename will be the simple file name. If a suffix is specified, and the specified file ends in that suffix, the basename will be the simple file name without the suffix.

attribute.name: file
attribute.description: File or directory to get base name from.

attribute.name: property
attribute.description: Property to set base name to.

attribute.name: suffix
attribute.description: Optional suffix to remove from base name.

task.name: copy
task.description:
Copies a file or directory to a new file or directory. Files are only copied if the source file is newer than the destination file, or when the destination file does not exist. It is possible to explicitly overwrite existing files.

This implementation is based on Arnout Kuiper's initial design document, the following mailing list discussions, and the copyfile/copydir tasks.

attribute.description: Sets the character encoding

attribute.name: failonerror
attribute.description: If false, note errors to the output but keep going.

attribute.required: yes, unless a nested <fileset> element is used.
attribute.description: Sets a single source file to copy.

attribute.name: filtering
attribute.description: If true, enables filtering.

attribute.name: flatten
attribute.description: When copying directory trees, the files can be "flattened" into a single directory. If there are multiple files with the same name in the source directory tree, only the first file will be copied into the "flattened" directory, unless the forceoverwrite attribute is true.

attribute.name: includeemptydirs
attribute.description: Used to copy empty directories.

attribute.name: overwrite
attribute.description: Overwrite any existing destination file(s).

attribute.name: preservelastmodified
attribute.description: Give the copied files the same last modified time as the original files.

attribute.name: todir
attribute.description: Sets the destination directory.

attribute.name: tofile
attribute.required: with the file attribute, either tofile or todir can be used. with nested <fileset> elements, if the set of files is greater than 1, or if only the dir attribute is specified in the <fileset>, or if the file attribute is also specified, then only todir is allowed.
attribute.description: Sets the destination file.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: Used to force listing of all names of copied files.

element.name: fileset
element.description: Adds a set of files to copy.

element.description: Adds a FilterChain.

element.name: filterset
element.description: Adds a filterset.

task.name: csc
task.description:
Compiles C# source into executables or modules. The task will only work on win2K until other platforms support csc.exe or an equivalent. CSC.exe must be on the execute path too.

All parameters are optional: <csc/> should suffice to produce a debug build of all *.cs files. References to external files do require explicit enumeration, so are one of the first attributes to consider adding.

The task is a directory based task, so attributes like includes="*.cs" and excludes="broken.cs" can be used to control the files pulled in. By default, all *.cs files from the project folder down are included in the command. When this happens the output file -if not specified- is taken as the first file in the list, which may be somewhat hard to control. Specifying the output file with 'outfile' seems prudent.

attribute.name: additionalmodules
attribute.description: Semicolon separated list of modules to refer to.

attribute.name: debug
attribute.description: set the debug flag on or off.

attribute.name: definitions
attribute.description: Semicolon separated list of defined constants.

attribute.name: destdir
attribute.description: Set the destination directory of files to be compiled.

attribute.name: destfile
attribute.description: Set the name of exe/library to create.

attribute.name: docfile
attribute.description: file for generated XML documentation

attribute.name: extraoptions
attribute.description: Any extra options which are not explicitly supported by this task.

attribute.name: failonerror
attribute.description: If true, fail on compilation errors.

attribute.name: filealign
attribute.description: Set the file alignment. Valid values are 0,512, 1024, 2048, 4096, 8192, and 16384, 0 means 'leave to the compiler'

attribute.name: fullpaths
attribute.description: If true, print the full path of files on errors.

attribute.name: includedefaultreferences
attribute.description: If true, automatically includes the common assemblies in dotnet, and tells the compiler to link in mscore.dll. set the automatic reference inclusion flag on or off this flag controls the string of references and the /nostdlib option in CSC

attribute.name: incremental
attribute.description: set the incremental compilation flag on or off.

attribute.name: noconfig
attribute.description: A flag that tells the compiler not to read in the compiler settings files 'csc.rsp' in its bin directory and its local directory

attribute.description: If true, enables optimization flag.

attribute.name: outputfile
attribute.description: Set the output file

attribute.description: Path of references to include. Wildcards should work.

attribute.name: references
attribute.description: Semicolon separated list of DLLs to refer to.

attribute.name: srcdir
attribute.description: Set the source directory of the files to be compiled.

attribute.name: targettype
attribute.description: Set the type of target.

attribute.name: unsafe
attribute.description: If true, enables the unsafe keyword.

attribute.description: If true, require all compiler output to be in UTF8 format.

attribute.description: Level of warning currently between 1 and 4 with 4 being the strictest.

task.name: cvschangelog
task.description: Generates an XML-formatted report file of the change logs recorded in a CVS repository. Important: This task needs "cvs" on the path. If it isn't, you will get an error (such as error 2 on windows). If the cvs task does not work, try to execute cvs.exe from the command line in the target directory in which you are working.

attribute.name: daysinpast
attribute.description: Sets the number of days into the past for which the change log information should be retrieved.

attribute.name: destfile

attribute.name: dir

attribute.name: end
attribute.description: The latest date to which change logs are to be included in the report.

attribute.name: start
attribute.description: The earliest date from which change logs are to be included in the report.

attribute.name: usersfile
attribute.description: Set a lookup list of user names & addresses

attribute.name: compression

attribute.name: quiet

task.name: ddcreator
task.description: Builds a serialized deployment descriptor given a text file description of the descriptor in the format supported by WebLogic. This ant task is a front end for the weblogic DDCreator tool.

task.name: delete
task.description:
Deletes a file or directory, or set of files defined by a fileset. The original delete task would delete a file, or a set of files using the include/exclude syntax. The deltree task would delete a directory tree. This task combines the functionality of these two originally distinct tasks.

Currently Delete extends MatchingTask. This is intend only to provide backwards compatibility for a release. The future position is to use nested filesets exclusively.

attribute.name: defaultexcludes
attribute.description: Sets whether default exclusions should be used or not.

attribute.name: dir
attribute.description: Set the directory from which files are to be deleted

attribute.name: excludes
attribute.description: Sets the set of exclude patterns. Patterns may be separated by a comma or a space.

attribute.name: excludesfile
attribute.description: Sets the name of the file containing the includes patterns.

attribute.name: failonerror
attribute.description: If false, note errors but continue.

attribute.name: file
attribute.required: at least one of the two, unless a <fileset> is specified.
attribute.description: Set the name of a single file to be removed.

attribute.name: includeemptydirs
attribute.description: If true, delete empty directories.

attribute.name: includes
attribute.description: Sets the set of include patterns. Patterns may be separated by a comma or a space.

attribute.name: includesfile
attribute.description: Sets the name of the file containing the includes patterns.

attribute.name: quiet
attribute.description: If true and the file does not exist, do not display a diagnostic message or modify the exit status to reflect an error. This means that if a file or directory cannot be deleted, then no error is reported. This setting emulates the -f option to the Unix "rm" command. Default is false meaning things are "noisy"

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: If true, list all names of deleted files.

element.name: fileset
element.description: Adds a set of files to be deleted.

element.name: exclude
element.description: add a name entry on the exclude list

element.name: excludesfile
element.description: add a name entry on the include files list

element.name: include
element.description: add a name entry on the include list

element.name: includesfile
element.description: add a name entry on the include files list

element.name: patternset
element.description: add a set of patterns

attribute.name: dir
attribute.description: Set the directory to be deleted

task.name: depend
task.description: Generates a dependency file for a given set of classes.

attribute.name: cache
attribute.description: Sets the dependency cache file.

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: Set the classpath to be used for this dependency check.

attribute.name: classpathref
attribute.description: Adds a reference to a classpath defined elsewhere.

attribute.name: closure
attribute.description: If true, transitive dependencies are followed until the closure of the dependency set if reached. When not set, the depend task will only follow direct dependencies between classes.

attribute.name: destdir
attribute.description: Set the destination directory where the compiled Java files exist.

attribute.name: dump
attribute.description: If true, the dependency information will be written to the debug level log.

attribute.name: srcdir
attribute.description: Set the directories path to find the Java source files.

element.name: classpath
element.description: Adds a classpath to be used for this dependency check.

task.name: dependset
task.description: Examines and removes out of date target files. If any of the target files are out of date with respect to any of the source files, all target files are removed. This is useful where dependencies cannot be computed (for example, dynamically interpreted parameters or files that need to stay in synch but are not directly linked) or where the ant task in question could compute them but does not (for example, the linked DTD for an XML file using the style task).

element.name: srcfilelist
element.description: Add a list of source files.

element.name: srcfileset
element.description: Add a set of source files.

element.name: targetfilelist
element.description: Add a list of target files.

element.name: targetfileset
element.description: Add a set of target files.

task.name: dirname
task.description:
Determines the directory name of the specified file. This task can accept the following attributes:
  • file
  • property
Both file and property are required.

When this task executes, it will set the specified property to the value of the specified file up to, but not including, the last path element. If file is a file, the directory will be the current directory.

attribute.name: file
attribute.description: Path to take the dirname of.

attribute.name: property
attribute.description: The name of the property to set.

task.name: ear
task.description: Creates a EAR archive. Based on WAR task

attribute.name: appxml
attribute.required: yes, unless update is set to true
attribute.description: File to incorporate as application.xml.

attribute.name: basedir
attribute.description: Directory from which to archive files.

attribute.name: compress
attribute.description: Whether we want to compress the files or only store them; default=true;

attribute.name: destfile
attribute.description: The file to create.

attribute.name: duplicate
attribute.description: Sets behavior for when a duplicate file is about to be added - one of keep, skip or overwrite. Possible values are: keep (keep both of the files); skip (keep the first version of the file found); overwrite overwrite the file with the new file Default for zip tasks is keep

attribute.name: encoding
attribute.description:
Encoding to use for filenames, defaults to the platform's default encoding.

For a list of possible values see http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/guide/internat/encoding.doc.html.

attribute.name: filesonly
attribute.description: If true, emulate Sun's jar utility by not adding parent directories; defaults to false.

attribute.name: index
attribute.description: Set whether or not to create an index list for classes. This may speed up classloading in some cases.

attribute.name: manifest
attribute.description: The manifest file to use. This can be either the location of a manifest, or the name of a jar added through a fileset. If its the name of an added jar, the task expects the manifest to be in the jar at META-INF/MANIFEST.MF.

attribute.name: update
attribute.description: If true, updates an existing file, otherwise overwrite any existing one; defaults to false.

attribute.name: whenempty
attribute.description: Sets behavior of the task when no files match. Possible values are: fail (throw an exception and halt the build); skip (do not create any archive, but issue a warning); create (make an archive with no entries). Default for zip tasks is skip; for jar tasks, create.

element.name: archives
element.description: Adds zipfileset.

element.name: manifest
element.description: Allows the manifest for the archive file to be provided inline in the buildfile rather than in an external file.

element.name: fileset
element.description: Adds a set of files.

element.name: metainf
element.description: Adds a zipfileset to include in the META-INF directory.

element.name: zipgroupfileset
element.description: Adds a group of zip files.

element.name: zipfileset
element.description: Adds a set of files that can be read from an archive and be given a prefix/fullpath.

task.name: echo
task.description: Writes a message to the Ant logging facilities.

attribute.name: append
attribute.description: If true, append to existing file.

attribute.name: file
attribute.description: File to write to.

attribute.name: level
attribute.description:
Set the logging level. Level should be one of
  • error
  • warning
  • info
  • verbose
  • debug

The default is "warning" to ensure that messages are displayed by default when using the -quiet command line option.

attribute.name: message
attribute.required: yes, unless data is included in a character section within this element.
attribute.description: Message to write.

task.name: echoproperties
task.description:
Displays all the current properties in the build. The output can be sent to a file if desired.

Attribute "destfile" defines a file to send the properties to. This can be processed as a standard property file later.

Attribute "prefix" defines a prefix which is used to filter the properties only those properties starting with this prefix will be echoed.

By default, the "failonerror" attribute is enabled. If an error occurs while writing the properties to a file, and this attribute is enabled, then a BuildException will be thrown. If disabled, then IO errors will be reported as a log statement, but no error will be thrown.

Examples: 

  <echoproperties  />
Report the current properties to the log. 

  <echoproperties destfile="my.properties" />
Report the current properties to the file "my.properties", and will fail the build if the file could not be created or written to. 

  <echoproperties destfile="my.properties" failonerror="false"
      prefix="ant" />
Report all properties beginning with 'ant' to the file "my.properties", and will log a message if the file could not be created or written to, but will still allow the build to continue.

attribute.name: destfile
attribute.description: Set a file to store the property output. If this is never specified, then the output will be sent to the Ant log.

attribute.name: failonerror
attribute.description: If true, the task will fail if an error occurs writing the properties file, otherwise errors are just logged.

attribute.name: prefix
attribute.description:
If the prefix is set, then only properties which start with this prefix string will be recorded. If this is never set, or it is set to an empty string or null, then all properties will be recorded.

For example, if the property is set as: 

<echoproperties  prefix="ant." />
then the property "ant.home" will be recorded, but "ant-example" will not.

task.name: ejbc
task.description: Builds EJB support classes using WebLogic's ejbc tool from a directory containing a set of deployment descriptors.

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: Set the classpath to be used for this compilation.

attribute.name: descriptors
attribute.description: Set the directory from where the serialized deployment descriptors are to be read.

attribute.name: dest
attribute.description: Set the directory into which the support classes, RMI stubs, etc are to be written.

attribute.name: keepgenerated
attribute.description: If true, ejbc will keep the intermediate Java files used to build the class files. This can be useful when debugging.

attribute.name: manifest
attribute.description: Set the name of the generated manifest file. For each EJB that is processed an entry is created in this file. This can then be used to create a jar file for dploying the beans.

attribute.name: src
attribute.description: Set the directory containing the source code for the home interface, remote interface and public key class definitions.

task.name: ejbjar
task.description:
Provides automated EJB JAR file creation.

Extends the MatchingTask class provided in the default ant distribution to provide a directory scanning EJB jarfile generator.

The task works by taking the deployment descriptors one at a time and parsing them to locate the names of the classes which should be placed in the jar. The classnames are translated to java.io.Files by replacing periods with File.separatorChar and resolving the generated filename as a relative path under the srcDir attribute. All necessary files are then assembled into a jarfile. One jarfile is constructed for each deployment descriptor found.

attribute.name: basejarname
attribute.description: Set the base name of the EJB JAR that is to be created if it is not to be determined from the name of the deployment descriptor files.

attribute.name: basenameterminator
attribute.description: The string which terminates the bean name. The convention used by this task is that bean descriptors are named as the BeanName with some suffix. The baseNameTerminator string separates the bean name and the suffix and is used to determine the bean name.

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: Set the classpath to use when resolving classes for inclusion in the jar.

attribute.name: dependency
attribute.description: Set the analyzer to use when adding in dependencies to the JAR.

attribute.name: descriptordir
attribute.description: Set the descriptor directory. The descriptor directory contains the EJB deployment descriptors. These are XML files that declare the properties of a bean in a particular deployment scenario. Such properties include, for example, the transactional nature of the bean and the security access control to the bean's methods.

attribute.name: destdir
attribute.description: Set the destination directory. The EJB jar files will be written into this directory. The jar files that exist in this directory are also used when determining if the contents of the jar file have changed. Note that this parameter is only used if no deployment tools are specified. Typically each deployment tool will specify its own destination directory.

attribute.name: flatdestdir
attribute.description: Controls whether the destination JARs are written out in the destination directory with the same hierarchical structure from which the deployment descriptors have been read. If this is set to true the generated EJB jars are written into the root of the destination directory, otherwise they are written out in the same relative position as the deployment descriptors in the descriptor directory.

attribute.name: genericjarsuffix
attribute.description: Set the suffix for the generated jar file. When generic jars are generated, they have a suffix which is appended to the the bean name to create the name of the jar file. Note that this suffix includes the extension fo te jar file and should therefore end with an appropriate extension such as .jar or .ear

attribute.name: manifest
attribute.description: Set the Manifest file to use when jarring. As of EJB 1.1, manifest files are no longer used to configure the EJB. However, they still have a vital importance if the EJB is intended to be packaged in an EAR file. By adding "Class-Path" settings to a Manifest file, the EJB can look for classes inside the EAR file itself, allowing for easier deployment. This is outlined in the J2EE specification, and all J2EE components are meant to support it.

attribute.name: naming
attribute.description: Set the naming scheme used to determine the name of the generated jars from the deployment descriptor

attribute.name: srcdir
attribute.description: Sets the source directory, which is the directory that contains the classes that will be added to the EJB jar. Typically this will include the home and remote interfaces and the bean class.

element.name: borland
element.description: Adds a deployment tool for Borland server.

element.name: classpath
element.description: Adds to the classpath used to locate the super classes and interfaces of the classes that will make up the EJB JAR.

element.name: dtd
element.description: Create a DTD location record. This stores the location of a DTD. The DTD is identified by its public Id. The location may either be a file location or a resource location.

element.name: iplanet
element.description: Adds a deployment tool for iPlanet Application Server.

element.name: jboss
element.description: Adds a deployment tool for JBoss server.

element.name: jonas
element.description: Adds a deployment tool for JOnAS server.

element.name: support
element.description: Adds a fileset for support elements.

element.name: weblogic
element.description: Adds a deployment tool for Weblogic server.

element.name: weblogictoplink
element.description: Adds a deployment tool for Weblogic when using the Toplink Object-Relational mapping.

element.name: websphere
element.description: Adds a deployment tool for Websphere 4.0 server.

task.name: exec
task.description: Executes a given command if the os platform is appropriate.

attribute.name: append
attribute.description: Whether output should be appended to or overwrite an existing file. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: dir
attribute.description: The working directory of the process.

attribute.name: executable

attribute.name: failifexecutionfails
attribute.description: Stop the build if program cannot be started. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: newenvironment

attribute.name: os
attribute.description: List of operating systems on which the command may be executed.

attribute.name: output
attribute.description: File the output of the process is redirected to.

attribute.name: outputproperty
attribute.description: Property name whose value should be set to the output of the process.

attribute.name: resultproperty
attribute.description: The name of a property in which the return code of the command should be stored. Only of interest if failonerror=false.

attribute.name: vmlauncher
attribute.description: If true, launch new process with VM, otherwise use the OS's shell.

element.name: env
element.description: Add an environment variable to the launched process.

element.name: arg
element.description: Adds a command-line argument.

task.name: fail
task.description: Exits the active build, giving an additional message if available.

attribute.name: if
attribute.description: Only fail if a property of the given name exists in the current project.

attribute.name: message
attribute.description: A message giving further information on why the build exited.

attribute.name: unless
attribute.description: Only fail if a property of the given name does not exist in the current project.

task.name: filter
task.description: Sets a token filter that is used by the file copy tasks to do token substitution. Sets mutiple tokens by reading these from a file.

attribute.name: filtersfile
attribute.description: The file from which the filters must be read. This file must be a formatted as a property file.

attribute.name: token
attribute.description: The token string without @ delimiters.

attribute.name: value

task.name: fixcrlf
task.description: Converts text source files to local OS formatting conventions, as well as repair text files damaged by misconfigured or misguided editors or file transfer programs.

attribute.required: no - defaults to default jvm encoding
attribute.description: Specifies the encoding Ant expects the files to be in - defaults to the platforms default encoding.

attribute.name: eof

attribute.name: javafiles
attribute.description: Set to true if modifying Java source files.

attribute.name: srcdir

attribute.name: tab

task.name: ftp
task.description:
Basic FTP client. Performs the following actions:
  • send - send files to a remote server. This is the default action.
  • get - retrive files from a remote server.
  • del - delete files from a remote server.
  • list - create a file listing.
  • chmod - change unix file permissions.
Note: Some FTP servers - notably the Solaris server - seem to hold data ports open after a "retr" operation, allowing them to timeout instead of shutting them down cleanly. This happens in active or passive mode, and the ports will remain open even after ending the FTP session. FTP "send" operations seem to close ports immediately. This behavior may cause problems on some systems when downloading large sets of files.

attribute.name: action
attribute.description: Sets the FTP action to be taken. Currently accepts "put", "get", "del", "mkdir", "chmod" and "list".

attribute.name: binary
attribute.description: If true, uses binary mode, otherwise text mode (default is binary).

attribute.name: chmod
attribute.description: Sets the file permission mode (Unix only) for files sent to the server.

attribute.name: depends
attribute.description: Set to true to transmit only files that are new or changed from their remote counterparts. The default is to transmit all files.

attribute.name: ignorenoncriticalerrors
attribute.description: Aet the flag to skip errors on directory creation. (and maybe later other server specific errors)

attribute.name: listing
attribute.description: The output file for the "list" action. This attribute is ignored for any other actions.

attribute.name: newer
attribute.description: A synonym for <tt>depends</tt>. Set to true to transmit only new or changed files.

attribute.name: passive
attribute.description: Specifies whether to use passive mode. Set to true if you are behind a firewall and cannot connect without it. Passive mode is disabled by default.

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: Sets the login password for the given user id.

attribute.name: port
attribute.description: Sets the FTP port used by the remote server.

attribute.name: remotedir
attribute.description: Sets the remote directory where files will be placed. This may be a relative or absolute path, and must be in the path syntax expected by the remote server. No correction of path syntax will be performed.

attribute.name: separator
attribute.description: Sets the remote file separator character. This normally defaults to the Unix standard forward slash, but can be manually overridden using this call if the remote server requires some other separator. Only the first character of the string is used.

attribute.name: server
attribute.description: Sets the FTP server to send files to.

attribute.name: skipfailedtransfers
attribute.description: If true, enables unsuccessful file put, delete and get operations to be skipped with a warning and the remainder of the files still transferred.

attribute.name: umask
attribute.description: Sets the default mask for file creation on a unix server.

attribute.name: userid
attribute.description: Sets the login user id to use on the specified server.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: Set to true to receive notification about each file as it is transferred.

element.name: fileset
element.description: A set of files to upload or download

task.name: genkey
task.description: Generates a key in a keystore.

attribute.name: alias
attribute.description: The alias to add under.

attribute.name: dname
attribute.description: The distinguished name for entity.

attribute.name: keyalg
attribute.description: The method to use when generating name-value pair.

attribute.name: keypass
attribute.description: Password for private key (if different).

attribute.name: keysize
attribute.description: Indicates the size of key generated.

attribute.name: keystore
attribute.description: Keystore location.

attribute.name: sigalg
attribute.description: The algorithm to use in signing.

attribute.name: storepass
attribute.description: Password for keystore integrity. Must be at least 6 characters long.

attribute.name: storetype
attribute.description: Keystore type.

attribute.name: validity
attribute.description: Indicates how many days certificate is valid.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: If true, verbose output when signing.

element.name: dname
element.description: Distinguished name list.

task.name: get
task.description: Gets a particular file from a URL source. Options include verbose reporting, timestamp based fetches and controlling actions on failures. NB: access through a firewall only works if the whole Java runtime is correctly configured.

attribute.name: dest
attribute.description: Where to copy the source file.

attribute.name: ignoreerrors
attribute.description: If true, log errors but do not treat as fatal.

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: password for the basic authentication.

attribute.name: src
attribute.description: Set the URL to get.

attribute.name: usetimestamp
attribute.description:
If true, conditionally download a file based on the timestamp of the local copy.

In this situation, the if-modified-since header is set so that the file is only fetched if it is newer than the local file (or there is no local file) This flag is only valid on HTTP connections, it is ignored in other cases. When the flag is set, the local copy of the downloaded file will also have its timestamp set to the remote file time.

Note that remote files of date 1/1/1970 (GMT) are treated as 'no timestamp', and web servers often serve files with a timestamp in the future by replacing their timestamp with that of the current time. Also, inter-computer clock differences can cause no end of grief.

attribute.name: username
attribute.description: Username for basic auth.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: If true, show verbose progress information.

task.name: gunzip
task.description: Expands a file that has been compressed with the GZIP algorithm. Normally used to compress non-compressed archives such as TAR files.

attribute.name: dest
attribute.description: The destination file or directory.

attribute.name: src
attribute.description: The file to expand.

task.name: gzip
task.description: Compresses a file with the GZIP algorithm. Normally used to compress non-compressed archives such as TAR files.

attribute.name: src
attribute.description: the file to compress; required.

attribute.name: zipfile
attribute.description: the required destination file.

task.name: icontract
task.description:
Instruments Java classes with iContract DBC preprocessor.
The task can generate a properties file for iControl, a graphical user interface that lets you turn on/off assertions. iControl generates a control file that you can refer to from this task using the controlfile attribute. iContract is at http://www.reliable-systems.com/tools/

Thanks to Rainer Schmitz for enhancements and comments.

attribute.name: builddir
attribute.description: Sets the build directory for instrumented classes.

attribute.name: classdir
attribute.description: Sets the class directory (uninstrumented classes).

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: Sets the classpath to be used for invocation of iContract.

attribute.name: classpathref
attribute.description: Adds a reference to a classpath defined elsewhere.

attribute.name: controlfile
attribute.description: Sets the control file to pass to iContract.

attribute.name: failthrowable
attribute.description: Sets the Throwable (Exception) to be thrown on assertion violation.

attribute.name: instrumentdir
attribute.description: Sets the instrumentation directory.

attribute.name: invariant
attribute.description: Turns on/off invariant instrumentation.

attribute.name: post
attribute.description: Turns on/off postcondition instrumentation.

attribute.name: pre
attribute.description: Turns on/off precondition instrumentation.

attribute.name: quiet
attribute.description: Tells iContract to be quiet.

attribute.name: repbuilddir
attribute.description: Sets the build directory for instrumented classes.

attribute.name: repositorydir
attribute.description: Sets the build directory for repository classes.

attribute.name: srcdir
attribute.description: Sets the source directory.

attribute.name: targets
attribute.description: Sets the name of the file where targets will be written. That is the file that tells iContract what files to process.

attribute.name: updateicontrol
attribute.description: If true, updates iControl properties file

attribute.name: verbosity
attribute.description: Sets the verbosity level of iContract. Any combination of error*,warning*,note*,info*,progress*,debug* (comma separated) can be used. Defaults to error*,warning*

element.name: classpath
element.description: Sets the classpath.

task.name: ilasm
task.description:
Assembles .NET Intermediate Language files. The task will only work on win2K until other platforms support csc.exe or an equivalent. ilasm.exe must be on the execute path too.

All parameters are optional: <il/> should suffice to produce a debug build of all *.il files. The option set is roughly compatible with the CSharp class; even though the command line options are only vaguely equivalent. [The low level commands take things like /OUT=file, csc wants /out:file ... /verbose is used some places; /quiet here in ildasm... etc.] It would be nice if someone made all the command line tools consistent (and not as brittle as the java cmdline tools)

The task is a directory based task, so attributes like includes="*.il" and excludes="broken.il" can be used to control the files pulled in. Each file is built on its own, producing an appropriately named output file unless manually specified with outfile

attribute.name: debug
attribute.description: set the debug flag on or off.

attribute.name: extraoptions
attribute.description: Any extra options which are not explicitly supported by this task.

attribute.name: failonerror
attribute.description: If true, fails if ilasm tool fails.

attribute.name: keyfile
attribute.description: the name of a file containing a private key.

attribute.name: listing
attribute.description: If true, produce a listing (off by default).

attribute.name: outputfile
attribute.description: Set the output file.

attribute.name: resourcefile
attribute.description: name of resource file to include.

attribute.name: srcdir
attribute.description: Set the source directory containing the files to be compiled.

attribute.name: targettype
attribute.description: Sets the type of target, either "exe" or "library".

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: If true, enable verbose ILASM output.

task.name: input
task.description: Reads an input line from the console.

attribute.name: addproperty
attribute.description: Defines the name of a property to be created from input. Behaviour is according to property task which means that existing properties cannot be overriden.

attribute.name: message
attribute.description: Sets the Message which gets displayed to the user during the build run.

attribute.name: validargs
attribute.description: Defines valid input parameters as comma separated strings. If set, input task will reject any input not defined as accepted and requires the user to reenter it. Validargs are case sensitive. If you want 'a' and 'A' to be accepted you need to define both values as accepted arguments.

task.name: iplanet-ejbc
task.description: Compiles EJB stubs and skeletons for the iPlanet Application Server. The EJBs to be processed are specified by the EJB 1.1 standard XML descriptor, and additional attributes are obtained from the iPlanet Application Server-specific XML descriptor. Since the XML descriptors can include multiple EJBs, this is a convenient way of specifying many EJBs in a single Ant task.

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: Sets the classpath to be used when compiling the EJB stubs and skeletons.

attribute.name: debug
attribute.description: If true, debugging output will be generated when ejbc is executed.

attribute.name: dest
attribute.description: Sets the destination directory where the EJB source classes must exist and where the stubs and skeletons will be written. The destination directory must exist before this task is executed.

attribute.name: ejbdescriptor
attribute.description: Sets the location of the standard XML EJB descriptor. Typically, this file is named "ejb-jar.xml".

attribute.name: iasdescriptor
attribute.description: Sets the location of the iAS-specific XML EJB descriptor. Typically, this file is named "ias-ejb-jar.xml".

attribute.name: iashome
attribute.description: May be used to specify the "home" directory for this iAS installation. The directory specified should typically be [install-location]/iplanet/ias6/ias.

attribute.name: keepgenerated
attribute.description: If true, the Java source files which are generated by ejbc will be saved .

element.name: classpath
element.description: Adds to the classpath used when compiling the EJB stubs and skeletons.

task.name: jar
task.description: Creates a JAR archive.

attribute.name: basedir
attribute.description: Directory from which to archive files.

attribute.name: compress
attribute.description: Whether we want to compress the files or only store them; default=true;

attribute.name: destfile
attribute.description: The file to create; required.

attribute.name: duplicate
attribute.description: Sets behavior for when a duplicate file is about to be added - one of keep, skip or overwrite. Possible values are: keep (keep both of the files); skip (keep the first version of the file found); overwrite overwrite the file with the new file Default for zip tasks is keep

attribute.name: encoding
attribute.description:
Encoding to use for filenames, defaults to the platform's default encoding.

For a list of possible values see http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/guide/internat/encoding.doc.html.

attribute.name: filesonly
attribute.description: If true, emulate Sun's jar utility by not adding parent directories; defaults to false.

attribute.name: index
attribute.description: Set whether or not to create an index list for classes. This may speed up classloading in some cases.

attribute.name: manifest
attribute.description: The manifest file to use. This can be either the location of a manifest, or the name of a jar added through a fileset. If its the name of an added jar, the task expects the manifest to be in the jar at META-INF/MANIFEST.MF.

attribute.name: update
attribute.description: If true, updates an existing file, otherwise overwrite any existing one; defaults to false.

attribute.name: whenempty
attribute.description: Sets behavior of the task when no files match. Possible values are: fail (throw an exception and halt the build); skip (do not create any archive, but issue a warning); create (make an archive with no entries). Default for zip tasks is skip; for jar tasks, create.

element.name: manifest
element.description: Allows the manifest for the archive file to be provided inline in the buildfile rather than in an external file.

element.name: fileset
element.description: Adds a set of files.

element.name: metainf
element.description: Adds a zipfileset to include in the META-INF directory.

element.name: zipgroupfileset
element.description: Adds a group of zip files.

element.name: zipfileset
element.description: Adds a set of files that can be read from an archive and be given a prefix/fullpath.

task.name: jarlib-available
task.description: Checks whether an extension is present in a fileset or an extensionSet.

attribute.name: file
attribute.required: no, one of file, nested extensionset or nested fileset must be present.
attribute.description: The JAR library to check.

attribute.name: property
attribute.description: The name of property to set if extensions are available.

element.name: extension
element.description: Set the Extension looking for.

element.name: extensionset
element.description: Adds a set of extensions to search in.

task.name: jarlib-display
task.description:
Displays the "Optional Package" and "Package Specification" information contained within the specified JARs.

Prior to JDK1.3, an "Optional Package" was known as an Extension. The specification for this mechanism is available in the JDK1.3 documentation in the directory $JDK_HOME/docs/guide/extensions/versioning.html. Alternatively it is available online at http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.3/docs/guide/extensions/versioning.html.

attribute.name: file
attribute.required: no, but one of file or fileset must be present.
attribute.description: The JAR library to display information for.

element.name: fileset
element.description: Adds a set of files about which library data will be displayed.

task.name: jarlib-manifest
task.description:
Generates a manifest that declares all the dependencies. The dependencies are determined by looking in the specified path and searching for Extension / "Optional Package" specifications in the manifests of the jars.

Prior to JDK1.3, an "Optional Package" was known as an Extension. The specification for this mechanism is available in the JDK1.3 documentation in the directory $JDK_HOME/docs/guide/extensions/versioning.html. Alternatively it is available online at http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.3/docs/guide/extensions/versioning.html.

attribute.name: destfile
attribute.description: The location where generated manifest is placed.

element.name: attribute
element.description: Adds an attribute that is to be put in main section of manifest.

element.name: depends
element.description: Adds a set of extensions that this library requires.

element.name: extension
element.description: Adds an extension that this library implements.

element.name: options
element.description: Adds a set of extensions that this library optionally requires.

task.name: jarlib-resolve
task.description: Tries to locate a JAR to satisfy an extension and place location of JAR into property.

attribute.name: checkextension
attribute.description: If true, libraries returned by nested resolvers should be checked to see if they supply extension.

attribute.name: failonerror
attribute.description: If true, failure to locate library should fail build.

attribute.name: property
attribute.description: The name of the property in which the location of library is stored.

element.name: ant
element.description: Adds Ant resolver to run an Ant buildfile to generate a library.

element.name: extension
element.description: Set the Extension looking for.

element.name: location
element.description: Adds location resolver to look for a library in a location relative to project directory.

element.name: url
element.description: Adds a URL resolver to download a library from a URL to a local file.

task.name: java
task.description: Executes a Java class within the running (Ant) VM or forks another VM if specified.

attribute.name: append
attribute.description: Whether output and error files should be appended to or overwritten. Defaults to false.

attribute.name: classname
attribute.description: The Java class to execute.

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: The classpath to use.

attribute.name: classpathref
attribute.description: The classpath to use, given as reference to a PATH defined elsewhere.

attribute.name: clonevm
attribute.description: If set to true, then all system properties and the bootclasspath of the forked Java Virtual Machine will be the same as those of the Java VM running Ant. Default is false (ignored if fork is disabled). Since Ant 1.7.0

attribute.name: dir
attribute.description: The directory to invoke the VM in (ignored if fork is disabled).

attribute.name: failonerror
attribute.description: Stop the buildprocess if the command exits with a returncode other than 0. Default is false.

attribute.name: fork
attribute.description: If enabled triggers the class execution in another VM (disabled by default)

attribute.name: jvmversion
attribute.description: Sets the JVM version.

attribute.name: jar
attribute.description: The location of the jar file to execute (must have a Main-Class entry in the manifest). Fork must be set to true if this option is selected.

attribute.name: jvm
attribute.description: The command used to invoke the Java Virtual Machine. Default is 'java'. The command is resolved by java.lang.Runtime.exec(). Ignored if fork is disabled.

attribute.name: jvmargs
attribute.description: The arguments to pass to the forked VM (ignored if fork is disabled). Deprecated, use nested jvmarg elements instead.

attribute.name: maxmemory
attribute.description: Maximum amount of memory to allocate to the forked VM (ignored if fork is disabled)

attribute.name: newenvironment
attribute.description: Do not propagate old environment when new environment variables are specified. Default is false (ignored if fork is disabled).

attribute.name: output
attribute.description: Name of a file to which to write the output. If the error stream is not also redirected to a file or property, it will appear in this output.

attribute.name: timeout
attribute.description: Stop the command if it doesn't finish within the specified time (given in milliseconds). It is highly recommended to use this feature only if fork is enabled.

element.name: env
element.description:
Adds an environment variable.

Will be ignored if we are not forking a new VM.

element.name: sysproperty
element.description: Adds a system property.

element.name: arg
element.description: Adds a command-line argument.

element.name: classpath
element.description: Adds a path to the classpath.

element.name: jvmarg
element.description: Adds a JVM argument.

task.name: javac
task.description: Compiles Java source files. This task can take the following When this task executes, it will recursively scan the sourcedir and destdir looking for Java source files to compile. This task makes its compile decision based on timestamp.

attribute.name: bootclasspathref
attribute.description: Adds a reference to a classpath defined elsewhere.

attribute.name: bootclasspath
attribute.description: Sets the bootclasspath that will be used to compile the classes against.

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: Set the classpath to be used for this compilation.

attribute.name: classpathref
attribute.description: Adds a reference to a classpath defined elsewhere.

attribute.name: compiler
attribute.description: Choose the implementation for this particular task.

attribute.name: debug
attribute.description: Indicates whether source should be compiled with debug information; defaults to off.

attribute.name: debuglevel
attribute.description: Keyword list to be appended to the -g command-line switch. This will be ignored by all implementations except modern and classic(ver >= 1.2). Legal values are none or a comma-separated list of the following keywords: lines, vars, and source. If debuglevel is not specified, by default, :none will be appended to -g. If debug is not turned on, this attribute will be ignored.

attribute.name: depend
attribute.description: Enables dependency-tracking for compilers that support this (jikes and classic).

attribute.name: deprecation
attribute.description: Indicates whether source should be compiled with deprecation information; defaults to off.

attribute.name: destdir
attribute.description: Set the destination directory into which the Java source files should be compiled.

attribute.name: encoding
attribute.description: Set the Java source file encoding name.

attribute.name: executable
attribute.description:
Sets the the name of the javac executable.

Ignored unless fork is true or extJavac has been specified as the compiler.

attribute.name: extdirs
attribute.description: Sets the extension directories that will be used during the compilation.

attribute.name: failonerror
attribute.description: Indicates whether the build will continue even if there are compilation errors; defaults to true.

attribute.name: fork
attribute.description: If true, forks the javac compiler.

attribute.name: includeantruntime
attribute.description: If true, includes Ant's own classpath in the classpath.

attribute.name: includejavaruntime
attribute.description: If true, includes the Java runtime libraries in the classpath.

attribute.name: listfiles
attribute.description: If true, list the source files being handed off to the compiler.

attribute.name: memoryinitialsize
attribute.description: The initial size of the memory for the underlying VM if javac is run externally; ignored otherwise. Defaults to the standard VM memory setting. (Examples: 83886080, 81920k, or 80m)

attribute.name: memorymaximumsize
attribute.description: The maximum size of the memory for the underlying VM if javac is run externally; ignored otherwise. Defaults to the standard VM memory setting. (Examples: 83886080, 81920k, or 80m)

attribute.name: nowarn
attribute.description: If true, enables the -nowarn option.

attribute.name: optimize
attribute.description: If true, compiles with optimization enabled.

attribute.name: source
attribute.description: Value of the -source command-line switch; will be ignored by all implementations except modern and jikes. If you use this attribute together with jikes, you must make sure that your version of jikes supports the -source switch. Legal values are 1.3 and 1.4 - by default, no -source argument will be used at all.

attribute.name: sourcepath
attribute.description: Set the sourcepath to be used for this compilation.

attribute.name: sourcepathref
attribute.description: Adds a reference to a source path defined elsewhere.

attribute.name: srcdir
attribute.required: yes, unless nested <src> elements are present.
attribute.description: Set the source directories to find the source Java files.

attribute.name: target
attribute.description: Sets the target VM that the classes will be compiled for. Valid strings are "1.1", "1.2", and "1.3".

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: If true, asks the compiler for verbose output.

element.name: bootclasspath
element.description: Adds a path to the bootclasspath.

element.name: classpath
element.description: Adds a path to the classpath.

element.name: compilerarg
element.description: Adds an implementation specific command-line argument.

element.name: extdirs
element.description: Adds a path to extdirs.

element.name: sourcepath
element.description: Adds a path to sourcepath.

element.name: src
element.description: Adds a path for source compilation.

task.name: javacc

task.name: javadoc
task.description:
Generates Javadoc documentation for a collection of source code.

Current known limitations are:

  • patterns must be of the form "xxx.*", every other pattern doesn't work.
  • there is no control on arguments sanity since they are left to the javadoc implementation.
  • argument J in javadoc1 is not supported (what is that for anyway?)

If no doclet is set, then the version and author are by default "yes".

Note: This task is run on another VM because the Javadoc code calls System.exit() which would break Ant functionality.

attribute.name: access
attribute.description: Set the scope to be processed. This is an alternative to the use of the setPublic, setPrivate, etc methods. It gives better build file control over what scope is processed.

attribute.name: additionalparam
attribute.description: Set an additional parameter on the command line

attribute.name: author
attribute.description: Include the author tag in the generated documentation.

attribute.name: bootclasspathref
attribute.description: Adds a reference to a CLASSPATH defined elsewhere.

attribute.name: bootclasspath
attribute.description: Set the boot classpath to use.

attribute.name: bottom
attribute.description: Set the text to be placed at the bottom of each output file.

attribute.name: charset
attribute.description: Charset for cross-platform viewing of generated documentation.

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: Set the classpath to be used for this javadoc run.

attribute.name: classpathref
attribute.description: Adds a reference to a CLASSPATH defined elsewhere.

attribute.name: defaultexcludes
attribute.description: Sets whether default exclusions should be used or not.

attribute.name: destdir
attribute.required: yes, unless a doclet has been specified.
attribute.description: Set the directory where the Javadoc output will be generated.

attribute.name: docencoding
attribute.description: Output file encoding name.

attribute.name: doclet
attribute.description: Set the class that starts the doclet used in generating the documentation.

attribute.name: docletpath
attribute.description: Set the classpath used to find the doclet class.

attribute.name: docletpathref
attribute.description: Set the classpath used to find the doclet class by reference.

attribute.name: doctitle
attribute.description: Set the title of the generated overview page.

attribute.name: encoding
attribute.description: Set the encoding name of the source files,

attribute.name: excludepackagenames
attribute.description: Set the list of packages to be excluded.

attribute.name: extdirs
attribute.description: Set the location of the extensions directories.

attribute.name: failonerror
attribute.description:
Should the build process fail if javadoc fails (as indicated by a non zero return code)?

Default is false.

attribute.name: footer
attribute.description: Set the footer text to be placed at the bottom of each output file.

attribute.name: group
attribute.description: Group specified packages together in overview page.

attribute.name: header
attribute.description: Set the header text to be placed at the top of each output file.

attribute.name: helpfile
attribute.description: Specifies the HTML help file to use.

attribute.name: link
attribute.description: Create links to javadoc output at the given URL.

attribute.name: linkoffline
attribute.description: Link to docs at "url" using package list at "url2" - separate the URLs by using a space character.

attribute.name: locale
attribute.description: Set the local to use in documentation generation.

attribute.name: maxmemory
attribute.description: Set the maximum memory to be used by the javadoc process

attribute.name: nodeprecated
attribute.description: If true, do not include @deprecated information.

attribute.name: nodeprecatedlist
attribute.description: If true, do not generate deprecated list.

attribute.name: nohelp
attribute.description: If true, do not generate help link

attribute.name: noindex
attribute.description: If true, do not generate index.

attribute.name: nonavbar
attribute.description: If true, do not generate navigation bar.

attribute.name: notree
attribute.description: If true, do not generate class hierarchy.

attribute.name: old
attribute.description: Indicate whether Javadoc should produce old style (JDK 1.1) documentation. This is not supported by JDK 1.1 and has been phased out in JDK 1.4

attribute.name: overview
attribute.description: Specify the file containing the overview to be included in the generated documentation.

attribute.name: package
attribute.description: Indicate whether only package, protected and public classes and members are to be included in the scope processed

attribute.name: packagelist
attribute.description: The name of a file containing the packages to process.

attribute.name: packagenames
attribute.description: Set the package names to be processed.

attribute.name: private
attribute.description: Indicate whether all classes and members are to be included in the scope processed

attribute.name: protected
attribute.description: Indicate whether only protected and public classes and members are to be included in the scope processed

attribute.name: public
attribute.description: Indicate whether only public classes and members are to be included in the scope processed

attribute.name: serialwarn
attribute.description: If true, generate warning about @serial tag.

attribute.name: source
attribute.description: Enables the -source switch, will be ignored if javadoc is not the 1.4 version or a different doclet than the standard doclet is used.

attribute.name: sourcefiles
attribute.description: Set the list of source files to process.

attribute.name: sourcepath
attribute.required: at least one of the three or nested <sourcepath>, <fileset> or <packageset>
attribute.description: Specify where to find source file

attribute.name: sourcepathref
attribute.description: Adds a reference to a CLASSPATH defined elsewhere.

attribute.name: splitindex
attribute.description: Generate a split index

attribute.name: stylesheetfile
attribute.description: Specifies the CSS stylesheet file to use.

attribute.name: use
attribute.description: Generate the "use" page for each package.

attribute.name: useexternalfile
attribute.description: Work around command line length limit by using an external file for the sourcefiles.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: Run javadoc in verbose mode

attribute.name: version
attribute.description: Include the version tag in the generated documentation.

attribute.name: windowtitle
attribute.description: Set the title to be placed in the HTML <title> tag of the generated documentation.

element.name: bottom
element.description: Set the text to be placed at the bottom of each output file.

element.name: doctitle
element.description: Add a document title to use for the overview page.

element.name: excludepackage
element.description: Add a package to be excluded from the javadoc run.

element.name: fileset
element.description:
Adds a fileset.

All included files will be added as sourcefiles. The task will automatically add includes="**/*.java" to the fileset.

element.name: footer
element.description: Set the footer text to be placed at the bottom of each output file.

element.name: header
element.description: Set the header text to be placed at the top of each output file.

element.name: package
element.description: Add a single package to be processed. If the package name ends with ".*" the Javadoc task will find and process all subpackages.

element.name: packageset

Adds a packageset.

All included directories will be translated into package names be converting the directory separator into dots.

element.name: source

element.name: taglet

element.name: bootclasspath
element.description: Create a Path to be configured with the boot classpath

element.name: classpath
element.description: Create a Path to be configured with the classpath to use

element.name: doclet
element.description: Create a doclet to be used in the documentation generation.

element.name: sourcepath

task.name: javah
task.description: Generates JNI headers from a Java class. When this task executes, it will generate the C header and source files that are needed to implement native methods. JNI operates differently depending on whether JDK1.2 (or later) or pre-JDK1.2 systems are used.

attribute.name: bootclasspathref
attribute.description: Adds a reference to a classpath defined elsewhere.

attribute.name: bootclasspath
attribute.description: location of bootstrap class files.

attribute.name: class
attribute.description: the fully-qualified name of the class (or classes, separated by commas).

attribute.name: classpath

attribute.name: classpathref
attribute.description: Adds a reference to a classpath defined elsewhere.

attribute.name: destdir
attribute.description: Set the destination directory into which the Java source files should be compiled.

attribute.name: force
attribute.description: If true, output files should always be written (JDK1.2 only).

attribute.name: outputfile

attribute.name: verbose

task.name: jdepend
task.description:
Runs JDepend tests.

JDepend is a tool to generate design quality metrics for each Java package. It has been initially created by Mike Clark. JDepend can be found at http://www.clarkware.com/software/JDepend.html. The current implementation spawn a new Java VM.

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: Set the classpath to be used for this compilation.

attribute.name: classpathref
attribute.description: Adds a reference to a classpath defined elsewhere.

attribute.name: dir
attribute.description: The directory to invoke the VM in. Ignored if no JVM is forked.

attribute.name: fork
attribute.description: If true, forks into a new JVM. Default: false.

attribute.name: format
attribute.description: The format to write the output in, "xml" or "text".

attribute.name: haltonerror
attribute.description: Whether or not to halt on failure. Default: false.

attribute.name: jvm
attribute.description: The command used to invoke a forked Java Virtual Machine. Default is <tt>java</tt>. Ignored if no JVM is forked.

task.name: jpcoverage
task.description:
Runs Sitraka JProbe Coverage. Options are pretty numerous, you'd better check the manual for a full descriptions of options. (not that simple since they differ from the online help, from the usage command line and from the examples...)

For additional information, visit www.sitraka.com

attribute.name: applet

attribute.name: classname

attribute.name: exitprompt

attribute.name: finalsnapshot

attribute.description: Path to the java executable.

attribute.name: recordfromstart

attribute.name: seedname
attribute.description: Seed name for the temporary snapshot files (files will be named seed.jpc, seed1.jpc, seed2.jpc, ...). Defaults to "snapshot".

attribute.name: snapshotdir
attribute.description: The path to the directory where snapshot files are stored. Choose a directory that is reachable by both the remote and local computers, and enter the same path on the command-line and in the viewer.

attribute.name: tracknatives
attribute.description: If true, track native methods.

attribute.name: vm
attribute.description: Indicates which virtual machine to run: "jdk117", "jdk118" or "java2". Can be null, default to "java2".

attribute.name: warnlevel

attribute.name: workingdir

element.name: arg

element.name: jvmarg

element.name: socket

element.name: triggers
element.description: Defines events to use for interacting with the collection of data performed during coverage. For example you may run a whole application but only decide to collect data once it reaches a certain method and once it exits another one.

task.name: jspc
task.description:
Runs a JSP compiler.

This task takes the given jsp files and compiles them into java files. It is then up to the user to compile the java files into classes.

The task requires the srcdir and destdir attributes to be set. This Task is a MatchingTask, so the files to be compiled can be specified using includes/excludes attributes or nested include/exclude elements. Optional attributes are verbose (set the verbosity level passed to jasper), package (name of the destination package for generated java classes and classpath (the classpath to use when running the jsp compiler).

This task supports the nested elements classpath (A Path) and classpathref (A Reference) which can be used in preference to the attribute classpath, if the jsp compiler is not already in the ant classpath.

Usage

 <jspc srcdir="${basedir}/src/war"
       destdir="${basedir}/gensrc"
       package="com.i3sp.jsp"
       verbose="9">
   <include name="**\/*.jsp" />
 </jspc>

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: Set the classpath to be used for this compilation.

attribute.name: classpathref
attribute.description: Adds a reference to a classpath defined elsewhere

attribute.name: compiler
attribute.description: Class name of a JSP compiler adapter.

attribute.name: compilerclasspath
attribute.description: Set the classpath to be used to find this compiler adapter

attribute.name: destdir
attribute.description: Set the destination directory into which the JSP source files should be compiled.

attribute.name: failonerror
attribute.description: Whether or not the build should halt if compilation fails. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: ieplugin
attribute.description: Java Plugin CLASSID for Internet Explorer

attribute.name: mapped
attribute.description: If true, generate separate write() calls for each HTML line in the JSP.

attribute.name: package
attribute.description: Set the name of the package the compiled jsp files should be in.

attribute.name: srcdir
attribute.description: Path for source JSP files.

attribute.name: uribase
attribute.description: The URI context of relative URI references in the JSP pages. If it does not exist then it is derived from the location of the file relative to the declared or derived value of uriroot.

attribute.name: uriroot
attribute.description: The root directory that uri files should be resolved against. (Default is the directory jspc is invoked from)

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: Set the verbose level of the compiler

attribute.name: webinc
attribute.description: output filename for the fraction of web.xml that lists servlets.

attribute.name: webxml
attribute.description: Filename for web.xml.

element.name: webapp
element.description: Adds a single webapp.

element.name: classpath
element.description: Adds a path to the classpath.

element.name: compilerclasspath
element.description: Support nested compiler classpath, used to locate compiler adapter

task.name: junit
task.description:
Runs JUnit tests.

JUnit is a framework to create unit test. It has been initially created by Erich Gamma and Kent Beck. JUnit can be found at http://www.junit.org.

JUnitTask can run a single specific JUnitTest using the test element.

This task can also run batches of tests. The batchtest element creates a BatchTest based on a fileset. This allows, for example, all classes found in directory to be run as testcases.

To spawn a new Java VM to prevent interferences between different testcases, you need to enable fork. A number of attributes and elements allow you to set up how this JVM runs.

attribute.name: dir
attribute.description: The directory to invoke the VM in. Ignored if no JVM is forked.

attribute.name: errorproperty
attribute.description:
Property to set to "true" if there is a error in a test.

This property is applied on all BatchTest (batchtest) and JUnitTest (test), however, it can possibly be overriden by their own properties.

attribute.name: failureproperty
attribute.description:
Property to set to "true" if there is a failure in a test.

This property is applied on all BatchTest (batchtest) and JUnitTest (test), however, it can possibly be overriden by their own properties.

attribute.name: filtertrace
attribute.description:
If true, smartly filter the stack frames of JUnit errors and failures before reporting them.

This property is applied on all BatchTest (batchtest) and JUnitTest (test) however it can possibly be overridden by their own properties.

attribute.name: fork
attribute.description:
If true, JVM should be forked for each test.

It avoids interference between testcases and possibly avoids hanging the build. this property is applied on all BatchTest (batchtest) and JUnitTest (test) however it can possibly be overridden by their own properties.

attribute.name: haltonerror
attribute.description: If true, stop the build process when there is an error in a test. This property is applied on all BatchTest (batchtest) and JUnitTest (test) however it can possibly be overridden by their own properties.

attribute.name: haltonfailure
attribute.description: If true, stop the build process if a test fails (errors are considered failures as well). This property is applied on all BatchTest (batchtest) and JUnitTest (test) however it can possibly be overridden by their own properties.

attribute.name: includeantruntime
attribute.description: If true, include ant.jar, optional.jar and junit.jar in the forked VM.

attribute.name: jvm
attribute.description: The command used to invoke the Java Virtual Machine, default is 'java'. The command is resolved by java.lang.Runtime.exec(). Ignored if fork is disabled.

attribute.name: maxmemory
attribute.description: Set the maximum memory to be used by all forked JVMs.

attribute.name: newenvironment
attribute.description:
If true, use a new environment when forked.

Will be ignored if we are not forking a new VM.

attribute.name: printsummary
attribute.description: If true, print one-line statistics for each test, or "withOutAndErr" to also show standard output and error. Can take the values on, off, and withOutAndErr.

attribute.name: showoutput
attribute.description:
If true, send any output generated by tests to Ant's logging system as well as to the formatters. By default only the formatters receive the output.

Output will always be passed to the formatters and not by shown by default. This option should for example be set for tests that are interactive and prompt the user to do something.

attribute.name: timeout
attribute.description:
Set the timeout value (in milliseconds).

If the test is running for more than this value, the test will be canceled. (works only when in 'fork' mode).

element.name: env
element.description:
Adds an environment variable; used when forking.

Will be ignored if we are not forking a new VM.

element.name: formatter
element.description: Add a new formatter to all tests of this task.

element.name: sysproperty
element.description: Adds a system property that tests can access. This might be useful to tranfer Ant properties to the testcases when JVM forking is not enabled.

element.name: test
element.description: Add a new single testcase.

element.name: batchtest
element.description: Adds a set of tests based on pattern matching.

element.name: classpath
element.description: Adds path to classpath used for tests.

element.name: jvmarg
element.description: Adds a JVM argument; ignored if not forking.

task.name: junitreport
task.description:
Aggregates all <junit> XML formatter testsuite data under a specific directory and transforms the results via XSLT. It is not particulary clean but should be helpful while I am thinking about another technique.

The main problem is due to the fact that a JVM can be forked for a testcase thus making it impossible to aggregate all testcases since the listener is (obviously) in the forked JVM. A solution could be to write a TestListener that will receive events from the TestRunner via sockets. This is IMHO the simplest way to do it to avoid this file hacking thing.

attribute.name: todir
attribute.description: Set the destination directory where the results should be written. If not set if will use {@link #DEFAULT_DIR}. When given a relative directory it will resolve it from the project directory.

attribute.name: tofile
attribute.description: Set the name of the aggregegated results file. It must be relative from the <tt>todir</tt> attribute. If not set it will use {@link #DEFAULT_FILENAME}

element.name: fileset
element.description: Add a new fileset containing the XML results to aggregate

element.name: report
element.description: Generate a report based on the document created by the merge.

task.name: keysubst
task.description: Keyword substitution. Input file is written to output file. Do not make input file same as output file. Keywords in input files look like this: @foo@. See the docs for the setKeys method to understand how to do the substitutions.

attribute.name: dest
attribute.description: Set the destination file.

attribute.name: keys
attribute.description:
Sets the keys. Format string is like this:

name=value*name2=value

Names are case sensitive.

Use the setSep() method to change the * to something else if you need to use * as a name or value.

attribute.name: sep
attribute.description: Sets the seperator between name=value arguments in setKeys(). By default it is "*".

Encoding to use for input, defaults to the platform's default encoding.

For a list of possible values see http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/guide/internat/encoding.doc.html .

task.name: manifest
task.description: Creates a manifest file. This task can be used to write a Manifest file, optionally replacing or updating an existing file. Manifests are processed according to the Jar file specification.. Specifically, a manifest element consists of a set of attributes and sections. These sections in turn may contain attributes. Note in particular that this may result in manifest lines greater than 72 bytes being wrapped and continued on the next line.

attribute.name: file
attribute.description: The name of the manifest file to create/update. Required if used as a task.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description: Update policy: either "update" or "replace"; default is "replace".

attribute.name: encoding
attribute.description: The encoding used to read the existing manifest when updating. Defaults to UTF-8 encoding.

element.description: Add an attribute to the manifest - it is added to the main section.

task.name: maudit
task.description:
Invokes the Metamata Audit/ Webgain Quality Analyzer on a set of Java files.

maudit performs static analysis of the Java source code and byte code files to find and report errors of style and potential problems related to performance, maintenance and robustness. As a convenience, a stylesheet is given in etc directory, so that an HTML report can be generated from the XML file.

attribute.name: fix
attribute.description: Automatically fix certain errors (those marked as fixable in the manual);, default=false

attribute.name: list
attribute.description: Creates listing file for each audited file; default false. When set, a .maudit file will be generated in the same location as the source file.

attribute.name: maxmemory
attribute.description: Set the maximum memory for the JVM; -mx or -Xmx depending on VM version

attribute.name: metamatahome
attribute.description: The home directory containing the Metamata distribution; required

attribute.name: tofile
attribute.description: The XML file to which the Audit result should be written to; required

attribute.name: unused
attribute.description: Finds declarations unused in search paths; default false. It will look for unused global declarations in the source code within a use domain specified by the <tt>searchpath</tt> element.

element.name: fileset
element.description: The java files or directory to audit. Whatever the filter is, only the files that end with .java will be included for processing. Note that the base directory used for the fileset MUST be the root of the source files otherwise package names deduced from the file path will be incorrect.

element.name: classpath
element.description: Sets the class path (also source path unless one explicitly set). Overrides METAPATH/CLASSPATH environment variables.

element.name: jvmarg
element.description:
Additional optional parameters to pass to the JVM. You can avoid using the <jvmarg> by adding these empty entries to metamata.properties located at ${metamata.home}/bin 
metamata.classpath=

element.description: Classpath for additional audit rules. These must be placed before metamata.jar!

element.name: searchpath
element.description: Search path to use for unused global declarations; required when <tt>unused</tt> is set.

element.name: sourcepath
element.description: Sets the source path. Overrides the SOURCEPATH environment variable.
