task.name: war
task.description:
An extension of <jar> to create a WAR archive. Contains special treatment for files that should end up in the WEB-INF/lib, WEB-INF/classes or WEB-INF directories of the Web Application Archive.

(The War task is a shortcut for specifying the particular layout of a WAR file. The same thing can be accomplished by using the prefix and fullpath attributes of zipfilesets in a Zip or Jar task.)

The extended zipfileset element from the zip task (with attributes prefix, fullpath, and src) is available in the War task.

attribute.name: basedir
attribute.description: Directory from which to archive files; optional.

attribute.name: compress
attribute.description: Whether we want to compress the files or only store them; optional, default=true;

attribute.name: destfile
attribute.description: The file to create; required.

attribute.name: duplicate
attribute.description: Sets behavior for when a duplicate file is about to be added - one of keep, skip or overwrite. Possible values are: keep (keep both of the files); skip (keep the first version of the file found); overwrite overwrite the file with the new file Default for zip tasks is keep

attribute.name: encoding
attribute.description:
Encoding to use for filenames, defaults to the platform's default encoding.

For a list of possible values see http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/guide/internat/encoding.doc.html.

attribute.name: filesonly
attribute.description: If true, emulate Sun's jar utility by not adding parent directories; optional, defaults to false.

attribute.name: index
attribute.description: Set whether or not to create an index list for classes. This may speed up classloading in some cases.

attribute.name: manifest
attribute.description: The manifest file to use. This can be either the location of a manifest, or the name of a jar added through a fileset. If its the name of an added jar, the task expects the manifest to be in the jar at META-INF/MANIFEST.MF.

attribute.name: update
attribute.description: If true, updates an existing file, otherwise overwrite any existing one; optional defaults to false.

attribute.name: webxml
attribute.required: yes, unless update is set to true
attribute.description: set the deployment descriptor to use (WEB-INF/web.xml); required unless <tt>update=true</tt>

attribute.name: whenempty
attribute.description: Sets behavior of the task when no files match. Possible values are: fail (throw an exception and halt the build); skip (do not create any archive, but issue a warning); create (make an archive with no entries). Default for zip tasks is skip; for jar tasks, create.

element.name: classes
element.description: add files under WEB-INF/classes

element.name: manifest
element.description: Allows the manifest for the archive file to be provided inline in the buildfile rather than in an external file.

element.name: fileset
element.description: Adds a set of files.

element.name: lib
element.description: add files under WEB-INF/lib/

element.name: metainf
element.description: Adds a zipfileset to include in the META-INF directory.

element.name: webinf
element.description: files to add under WEB-INF;

element.name: zipgroupfileset
element.description: Adds a group of zip files.

element.name: zipfileset
element.description: Adds a set of files that can be read from an archive and be given a prefix/fullpath.

task.name: wljspc
task.description: Precompiles JSP's using WebLogic's JSP compiler (weblogic.jspc).

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: Set the classpath to be used for this compilation.

attribute.name: dest
attribute.description: Root of destination directory, what you have set as WorkingDir in the weblogic properties.

attribute.name: package
attribute.description: Set the package under which the compiled classes go

attribute.name: src
attribute.description: Root of source tree for JSP, ie, the document root for your weblogic server.

element.name: classpath
element.description: Maybe creates a nested classpath element.

task.name: wlrun
task.description: Starts a WebLogic server. A number of parameters are used to control the operation of the weblogic instance. Note that the task, and hence ant, will not complete until the weblogic instance is stopped.

attribute.name: args
attribute.description: Additional argument string passed to the Weblogic instance; optional.

attribute.name: beahome
attribute.description: The location of the BEA Home; implicitly selects Weblogic 6.0; optional.

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: The classpath to be used with the Java Virtual Machine that runs the Weblogic Server; required. Prior to Weblogic 6.0, this is typically set to the Weblogic boot classpath. Under Weblogic 6.0 this should include all the weblogic jars

attribute.name: domain
attribute.description: Set the Domain to run in; required for WL6.0

attribute.name: home
attribute.description: The location where weblogic lives. Required. This is the absolute location, not relative to BEA home.

attribute.name: jvmargs
attribute.description: Set the additional arguments to pass to the weblogic JVM

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the weblogic server within the weblogic home which is to be run. Optiona, defaults to "myserver"

attribute.name: pkpassword
attribute.description: Set the private key password so the server can decrypt the SSL private key file; optional and only applicable to WL6.0.

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: Set the management password of the server; optional and only applicable to WL6.0.

attribute.name: policy
attribute.description: The name of the security policy file within the weblogic home directory that is to be used. If not specified, the default policy file weblogic.policy is used.

attribute.name: username
attribute.description: Set the management username to run the server; optional and only applicable to WL6.0.

attribute.name: weblogicmainclass
attribute.description: name of the main class for weblogic; optional.

attributes.attribute:
optional, and only applicable to WL4.5.1
Set the weblogic classpath used by the Weblogic Server; optional, and only applicable to WL4.5.1 The weblogic classpath is used by weblogic to support dynamic class loading.

element.name: classpath
element.description: Add the classpath for the user classes

element.name: wlclasspath
element.description: Get the classpath to the weblogic classpaths

task.name: wlstop
task.description: Shuts down a WebLogic server. To shut down an instance you must supply both a username and a password.

attribute.name: beahome
attribute.description: The location of the BEA Home; implicitly selects Weblogic 6.0 shutdown; optional.

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: The classpath to be used with the Java Virtual Machine that runs the Weblogic Shutdown command;

attribute.name: delay
attribute.description: Set the delay (in seconds) before shutting down the server; optional.

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: The password for the account specified in the user parameter; required

attribute.name: url
attribute.description: Set the URL to which the weblogic server is listening for T3 connections; required.

attribute.name: user
attribute.description: The username of the account which will be used to shutdown the server; required.

element.name: classpath
element.description: The classpath to be used with the Java Virtual Machine that runs the Weblogic Shutdown command;

task.name: wsdltodotnet
task.description: Converts a WSDL file or URL resource into a .NET language. See "Creating an XML Web Service Proxy", "wsdl.exe" docs in the framework SDK documentation

attribute.name: destfile
attribute.description: Name of the file to generate. Required

attribute.name: extraoptions
attribute.description: Any extra WSDL.EXE options which aren't explicitly supported by the ant wrapper task; optional

attribute.name: failonerror
attribute.description: Should failure halt the build? optional, default=true

attribute.name: language
attribute.description: set the language; one of "CS", "JS", or "VB" optional, default is CS for C# source

attribute.name: namespace
attribute.description: namespace to place the source in. optional; default ""

attribute.name: server
attribute.description: flag to enable server side code generation; optional, default=false

attribute.name: srcfile
attribute.description: The local WSDL file to parse; either url or srcFile is required.

attribute.name: url
attribute.description: Sets the URL to fetch. Fetching is by wsdl.exe; Ant proxy settings are ignored; either url or srcFile is required.

task.name: xmlproperty
task.description: Loads property values from a valid XML file, generating the property names from the file's element and attribute names.

attribute.name: collapseattributes
attribute.description: flag to treat attributes as nested elements; optional, default false

attribute.name: file
attribute.description: The XML file to parse; required.

attributes.attribute:
first value in the property name; optional,
flag to include the xml root tag as a first value in the property name; optional, default is true

attribute.name: prefix
attribute.description: the prefix to prepend to each property

attribute.name: validate
attribute.description: flag to validate the XML file; optional, default false

task.name: xmlvalidate
task.description: Checks XML files are valid (or only well formed). The task uses the SAX2 parser implementation provided by JAXP by default (probably the one that is used by Ant itself), but one can specify any SAX1/2 parser if needed

attribute.name: classname
attribute.description: Specify the class name of the SAX parser to be used. (optional)

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: Specify the classpath to be searched to load the parser (optional)

attribute.name: classpathref
attribute.description: Where to find the parser class; optional.

attributes.attribute:
optional, default=true

Specify how parser error are to be handled; optional, default=true

If set to true (default), throw a buildException if the parser yields an error.

attribute.name: file
attribute.description: specify the file to be checked; optional.

attribute.name: lenient
attribute.description:
Specify whether the parser should be validating. Default is true.

If set to false, the validation will fail only if the parsed document is not well formed XML.

this option is ignored if the specified class with {@link #setClassName(String)} is not a SAX2 XMLReader.

attribute.name: warn
attribute.description:
Specify how parser error are to be handled.

If set to true (default), log a warn message for each SAX warn event.

element.name: xmlcatalog
element.description: add an XMLCatalog as a nested element; optional.

element.name: fileset
element.description: specify a set of file to be checked

element.name: dtd
element.description: Create a DTD location record; optional. This stores the location of a DTD. The DTD is identified by its public Id.

task.name: xslt
task.description: Processes a set of XML documents via XSLT. This is useful for building views of XML based documentation.

attribute.name: basedir
attribute.description: Set the base directory; optional, default is the project's basedir.

attribute.name: classpath
attribute.description: Set the optional classpath to the XSL processor

attribute.name: classpathref
attribute.description: Set the reference to an optional classpath to the XSL processor

attribute.name: destdir
attribute.required: yes, unless in and out have been specified.
attribute.description: Set the destination directory into which the XSL result files should be copied to; required, unless <tt>in</tt> and <tt>out</tt> are specified.

attribute.name: extension
attribute.description: Set the desired file extension to be used for the target; optional, default is html.

attribute.name: force
attribute.description: Set whether to check dependencies, or always generate; optional, default is false.

attribute.name: in
attribute.description: specifies a single XML document to be styled. Should be used with the <tt>out</tt> attribute; ; required if <tt>out</tt> is set

attribute.name: out
attribute.description: Specifies the output name for the styled result from the <tt>in</tt> attribute; required if <tt>in</tt> is set

attribute.name: processor
attribute.description: Set the name of the XSL processor to use; optional, default trax. Other values are "xalan" for Xalan1 and "xslp" for XSL:P, though the later is strongly deprecated.

attribute.name: scanincludeddirectories
attribute.description: Whether to style all files in the included directories as well; optional, default is true.

attribute.name: style
attribute.description: Name of the stylesheet to use - given either relative to the project's basedir or as an absolute path; required.

element.name: xmlcatalog
element.description: Add the catalog to our internal catalog

element.name: classpath
element.description: Set the optional classpath to the XSL processor

element.name: outputproperty
element.description: Create an instance of an output property to be configured.

element.name: param
element.description: Create an instance of an XSL parameter for configuration by Ant.

task.name: zip
task.description: Create a Zip file.

attribute.name: basedir
attribute.description: Directory from which to archive files; optional.

attribute.name: compress
attribute.description: Whether we want to compress the files or only store them; optional, default=true;

attribute.name: destfile
attribute.description: The file to create; required.

attribute.name: duplicate
attribute.description: Sets behavior for when a duplicate file is about to be added - one of keep, skip or overwrite. Possible values are: keep (keep both of the files); skip (keep the first version of the file found); overwrite overwrite the file with the new file Default for zip tasks is keep

attribute.name: encoding
attribute.description:
Encoding to use for filenames, defaults to the platform's default encoding.

For a list of possible values see http://java.sun.com/products/jdk/1.2/docs/guide/internat/encoding.doc.html.

attribute.name: filesonly
attribute.description: If true, emulate Sun's jar utility by not adding parent directories; defaults to false.

attribute.name: update
attribute.description: If true, updates an existing file, otherwise overwrite any existing one; defaults to false.

attribute.name: whenempty
attribute.description: Sets behavior of the task when no files match. Possible values are: fail (throw an exception and halt the build); skip (do not create any archive, but issue a warning); create (make an archive with no entries). Default for zip tasks is skip; for jar tasks, create.

element.name: fileset
element.description: Adds a set of files.

element.name: zipgroupfileset
element.description: Adds a group of zip files.

element.name: zipfileset
element.description: Adds a set of files that can be read from an archive and be given a prefix/fullpath.

task.name: target
task.description: Ant target that is executable and may depend on other targets.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: the name of the target.

attribute.name: depends
attribute.description: a comma-separated list of names of targets on which this target depends.

attribute.name: if
attribute.description: the name of the property that must be set in order for this target to execute.

attribute.name: unless
attribute.description: the name of the property that must not be set in order for this target to execute.

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: a short description of this target's function.

task.name: macrodef
task.description: This defines a new task using a sequential nested task as a template. Nested elements attribute and element are used to specify attributes and elements of the new task. These get substituted into the sequential task when the new task is run. Since Ant 1.6.0.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the new definition.

attribute.name: uri
attribute.description: The uri that this definition should live in.

element.name: attribute
element.description: This is used to specify attributes of the new task. The values of the attributes get substituted into the templated task. The attributes will be required attributes unless a default value has been set. This attribute is placed in the body of the templated task using a notation similar to the ant property notation - @{attribute name}. (May be remembered as "put the substitution AT this location"). The escape sequence @@{x} is used to allow @{x} to be placed in the text without substitution of x. This corresponds to the $${x} escape sequence for properties

element.name: element
element.description: This is used to specify nested elements of the new task. The contents of the nested elements of the task instance are placed in the templated task at the tag name.

task.name: import
task.description: Imports another build file into the current project. Since Ant 1.6.0.

attribute.name: file
attribute.description: The file to import.

attribute.name: optional
attribute.description: If true, do not issue stop the build if the file does not exist. Default is false.

task.name: presetdef
task.description: The preset definition generates a new definition based on a current definition with some attributes or elements preset. Since Ant 1.6.0.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of the new definition.

attribute.name: uri
attribute.description: The uri that this definition should live in.

task.name: scp
task.description: Copies a file or FileSet to or from a remote machine running SSH daemon. FileSet only works for copying files from the local machine to a remote machine. Note: This task depends on external libraries not included in the Ant distribution Since Ant 1.6.

attribute.name: file
attribute.description: The file to copy. This can be a local path or a remote path of the form user[:password]@host:/directory/path. :password can be ommitted if you use key based authentication or specify the password attribute. The way remote path is recognized is whether it contains @ character or not. This will not work if your localPath contains @ character.

attribute.name: localFile
attribute.description: This is an alternative to the file attribute. But this must always point to a local file. The reason this was added was that when you give file attribute it is treated as remote if it contains @ character. This character can exist also in local paths. since Ant 1.6.2

attribute.name: remoteFile
attribute.description: This is an alternative to the file attribute. But this must always point to a remote file. since Ant 1.6.2

attribute.name: todir
attribute.description: The directory to copy to. This can be a local path or a remote path of the form user[:password]@host:/directory/path. :password can be ommitted if you use key based authentication or specify the password attribute. The way remote path is recognized is whether it contains @ character or not. This will not work if your localPath contains @ character.

attribute.name: localTodir
attribute.description: This is an alternative to the todir attribute. But this must always point to a local directory. The reason this was added was that when you give todir attribute it is treated as remote if it contains @ character. This character can exist also in local paths. since Ant 1.6.2

attribute.name: localTofile
attribute.description: Changes the file name to the given name while receiving it, only useful if receiving a single file. since Ant 1.6.2

attribute.name: remoteTodir
attribute.description: This is an alternative to the todir attribute. But this must always point to a remote directory. since Ant 1.6.2

attribute.name: remoteTofile
attribute.description: Changes the file name to the given name while sending it, only useful if sending a single file. since Ant 1.6.2

attribute.name: port
attribute.description: The port to connect to on the remote host..

attribute.name: trust
attribute.description: This trusts all unknown hosts if set to yes/true. Note If you set this to false (the default), the host you connect to must be listed in your knownhosts file, this also implies that the file exists.

attribute.name: knownhosts
attribute.description: This sets the known hosts file to use to validate the identity of the remote host. This must be a SSH2 format file. SSH1 format is not supported.

attribute.name: failonerror
attribute.description: Whether to halt the build if the transfer fails.

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: The password.

attribute.name: keyfile
attribute.description: Location of the file holding the private key.

attribute.name: passphrase
attribute.description: Passphrase for your private key.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: Determines whether SCP outputs verbosely to the user. Currently this means outputting dots/stars showing the progress of a file transfer. Since Ant 1.6.2.

task.name: sshexec
task.description: Runs a command on a remote machine running SSH daemon. Note: This task depends on external libraries not included in the Ant distribution. This task has been tested with jsch-0.1.7 to jsch-0.1.9 and won't work with versions of jsch earlier than 0.1.7. Since Ant 1.6.

attribute.name: host
attribute.description: The hostname or IP address of the remote host to which you wish to connect.

attribute.name: username
attribute.description: The username on the remote host to which you are connecting.

attribute.name: command
attribute.description: The command to run on the remote host.

attribute.name: port
attribute.description: The port to connect to on the remote host. Defaults to 22

attribute.name: trust
attribute.description: This trusts all unknown hosts if set to yes/true. Note If you set this to false (the default), the host you connect to must be listed in your knownhosts file, this also implies that the file exists.

attribute.name: knownhosts
attribute.description: This sets the known hosts file to use to validate the identity of the remote host. This must be a SSH2 format file. SSH1 format is not supported. Defaults to ${user.home}/.ssh/known_hosts.

attribute.name: failonerror
attribute.description: Whether to halt the build if the command does not complete successfully. Defaults to true

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: The password.

attribute.name: keyfile
attribute.description: Location of the file holding the private key.

attribute.name: passphrase
attribute.description: Passphrase for your private key. Defaults to the empty string

attribute.name: output
attribute.description: Name of a file to which to write the output.

attribute.name: append
attribute.description: Whether output file should be appended to or overwritten. Defaults to false, meaning overwrite any existing file.

attribute.name: outputproperty
attribute.description: The name of a property in which the output of the command should be stored.

attribute.name: timeout
attribute.description: Stop the command if it doesn't finish within the specified time (given in milliseconds). Defaults to 0 which means "wait forever".

task.name: jjdoc
task.description: Invokes the JJDoc preprocessor for the JavaCC compiler compiler. It takes a JavaCC parser specification and produces documentation for the BNF grammar. It can operate in three modes, determined by command line options. To use the jjdoc task, set the target attribute to the name of the JavaCC grammar file to process. You also need to specify the directory containing the JavaCC installation using the javacchome attribute, so that ant can find the JavaCC classes. Optionally, you can also set the outputfile to write the generated BNF documentation file to a specific (directory and) file. Otherwise jjdoc writes the generated BNF documentation file as the JavaCC grammar file with a suffix .txt or .html. This task only invokes JJDoc if the grammar file is newer than the generated BNF documentation file. Since Ant 1.6.

attribute.name: target
attribute.description: The javacc grammar file to process.

attribute.name: javacchome
attribute.description: The directory containing the JavaCC distribution.

attribute.name: outputfile
attribute.description: The file to write the generated BNF documentation file to. If not set, the file is written with the same name as the JavaCC grammar file but with a the suffix .html or .txt.

attribute.name: text
attribute.description: Sets the TEXT BNF documentation option. This is a boolean option.

attribute.name: onetable
attribute.description: Sets the ONE_TABLE BNF documentation option. This is a boolean option.

task.name: chgrp
task.description: Changes the group of a file or all files inside specified directories. Right now it has effect only under Unix. The group atribute is equivalent to the coresponding argument for the chgrp command. FileSets, DirSets or FileLists can be specified using nested <fileset>, <dirset> and <filelist> elements. Since Ant 1.6.

attribute.name: file
attribute.description: The file or directory of which the group must be changed. Required if nested <fileset/list> elements not provided

attribute.name: group
attribute.description: The new group.

attribute.name: parallel
attribute.description: Process all specified files using a single chgrp command. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: One of file, dir or both. If set to file, only the group of plain files are going to be changed. If set to dir, only the directories are considered. Note: The type attribute does not apply to nested dirsets - dirsets always implicitly assume type to be dir. Defaults to file

attribute.name: maxparallel
attribute.description: Limit the amount of parallelism by passing at most this many sourcefiles at once. Set it to <= 0 for unlimited. Defaults to unlimited.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: Whether to print a summary after execution or not. Defaults to false.

task.name: chown
task.description: Changes the owner of a file or all files inside specified directories. Right now it has effect only under Unix. The owner atribute is equivalent to the coresponding argument for the chown command. FileSets, DirSets or FileLists can be specified using nested <fileset>, <dirset> and <filelist> elements. Since Ant 1.6.

attribute.name: file
attribute.description: The file or directory of which the owner must be changed. Required if nested <fileset/list> elements not provided

attribute.name: owner
attribute.description: The new owner.

attribute.name: parallel
attribute.description: Process all specified files using a single chgrp command. Defaults to true.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: One of file, dir or both. If set to file, only the owner of plain files are going to be changed. If set to dir, only the directories are considered. Note: The type attribute does not apply to nested dirsets - dirsets always implicitly assume type to be dir. Defaults to file

attribute.name: maxparallel
attribute.description: Limit the amount of parallelism by passing at most this many sourcefiles at once. Set it to <= 0 for unlimited. Defaults to unlimited.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: Whether to print a summary after execution or not. Defaults to false.

task.name: attrib
task.description: Changes the attributes of a file or all files inside specified directories. Right now it has effect only under Windows. Each of the 4 possible permissions has its own attribute, matching the arguments for the attrib command. FileSets, DirSets or FileLists can be specified using nested <fileset>, <dirset> and <filelist> elements. Since Ant 1.6.

attribute.name: file
attribute.description: The file or directory of which the permissions must be changed. Required if nested <fileset/list> elements not provided

attribute.name: readonly
attribute.description: The readonly permission

attribute.name: archive
attribute.description: The archive permission.

attribute.name: system
attribute.description: The system permission.

attribute.name: hidden
attribute.description: The hidden permission.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: One of file, dir or both. If set to file, only the permissions of plain files are going to be changed. If set to dir, only the directories are considered. Note: The type attribute does not apply to nested dirsets - dirsets always implicitly assume type to be dir.

attribute.name: verbose
attribute.description: Whether to print a summary after execution or not. Defaults to false.
